objects.action: A command that can be run.
objects.alarm: A condition that triggers Alerts or Actions.
objects.bot: An automation that ties an Action to an Alert.
objects.circuit_breaker: An automatic rate limit on actions.
objects.file: A datafile that is automatically copied/distributed to defined Resources.
objects.integration: A third-party integration (e.g. DataDog, NewRelic, etc) .
objects.metric: A periodic measurement of a system property.
objects.notebook: An interactive notebook of Op commands and user documentation .
objects.principal: An authorization group (e.g. Okta groups). Note: Admin privilege (in {{ .RENDERED_PROVIDER_NAME }}) to create principal objects.
objects.resource: A server or compute resource in the system (e.g. host, pod, container).
objects.system_settings: System-level settings. Note: there must only be one instance of this terraform resource named 'system_settings'.
objects.report_template: A resource report template. Note: Configure privilege (in {{ .RENDERED_PROVIDER_NAME }}) to create report template objects.
objects.dashboard: A platform for visualizing resources and their associated tags.

attributes.name: The name/symbol for the object within {{ .RENDERED_PROVIDER_NAME }} and the op language (must be unique, only alphanumeric/underscore).
attributes.type: The type of object (i.e., Alarm, Action, Bot, Metric, Resource, or File).
attributes.action_limit: The number of simultaneous actions allowed for a permissions group.
attributes.administer_permission: If a permissions group is allowed to perform "administer" actions.
attributes.allowed_entities: The list of users who can run an action or notebook. Any user can run if left empty.
attributes.allowed_resources_query: The list of resources on which an action or notebook can run. No restriction, if left empty.
attributes.cells: The data cells inside a notebook. Defined as a list of JSON objects. These may be either Markdown or Op commands.
attributes.checksum: Cryptographic hash (e.g. md5) of a File Resource.
attributes.compile_eligible: If the Alarm can be effectively optimized.
attributes.complete_long_template: The long description of the Action's completion.
attributes.complete_short_template: The short description of the Action's completion.
attributes.complete_title_template: UI title of the Action's completion.
attributes.condition_type: Kind of check in an Alarm (e.g. above or below) vs a threshold for a Metric.
attributes.condition_value: Switching value (threshold) for a Metric in an Alarm.
attributes.configure_permission: If a permissions group is allowed to perform "configure" actions.
attributes.data: The JSON representation of a Notebook. If this field is used, then the JSON should only contain these four fields: cells, params, external_params and enabled.
attributes.description: A user-friendly explanation of an object.
attributes.destination_path: Target location for a copied distributed File object.
attributes.enabled: If the object is currently enabled or disabled.
attributes.end_date: When the trigger condition stops firing. (defaults to unset, e.g. no stop date). The accepted format is ISO8601, e.g. '2029-02-17T08:08:01'.
attributes.error_long_template: The long description of the Action's error condition.
attributes.error_short_template: The short description of the Action's error condition.
attributes.error_title_template: UI title of the Action's error condition.
attributes.event_type: Used to tag external triggers vs '{{ .DEFAULT_TRIGGER_SOURCE }}' alarms (default).
attributes.execute_limit: The number of simultaneous linux (shell) commands allowed for a permissions group.
attributes.family: General class for an Action or Bot (e.g., custom, standard, metric, or system check).
attributes.file_data: Internal representation of a distributed File object's data (computed).
attributes.file_length: Length, in bytes, of a distributed File object (computed)
attributes.fire_long_template: The long description of the Alarm's triggering condition.
attributes.fire_query: The trigger condition for an Alarm (general expression) or the TimeTrigger (e.g. 'every 5m').
attributes.fire_short_template: The short description of the Alarm's triggering condition.
attributes.fire_title_template: UI title of the Alarm's triggering condition.
attributes.identity: The email address or provider's (e.g. Okta) group-name for a permissions group.
attributes.identifiers: A list of additional tags that will be used to identify certain resources. They will be displayed before the tags_sequence column.
attributes.input_file: The local source of a distributed File object. (conflicts with inline_data)
attributes.inline_data: The inline file data of a distributed File object. (conflicts with input_file)
attributes.labels: A list of strings by which notebooks can be grouped.
attributes.md5: The md5 checksum of a file, e.g. filemd5("${path.module}/data/example-file.txt")
attributes.mode: The File's permissions, like 'chmod', in octal (e.g. '0644').
attributes.monitor_id: For 'datadog' monitor triggered bots, the DD monitor identifier.
attributes.params: Named variables to pass to an object (e.g. an Action).
attributes.external_params: Notebook parameters defined via with a JSON path used to extract the parameter's value from an external payload, such as an Alertmanager alert.
attributes.raise_for: Where an Alarm is raised (e.g., local to a resource, or global to the system).
attributes.res_env_var: Result environment variable ... an environment variable used to output values through.
attributes.resolve_long_template: The long description of the Alarm's resolution.
attributes.resolve_short_template: The short description of the Alarm's resolution.
attributes.resolve_title_template: UI title of the Alarm's' resolution.
attributes.resource_query: A set of Resources (e.g. host, pod, container), optionally filtered on tags or dynamic conditions.
attributes.start_date: When the trigger condition starts firing (defaults to creation/update time of the trigger). The accepted format is ISO8601, e.g. '2024-02-17T08:08:01'.
attributes.start_long_template: The long description when starting the Action.
attributes.start_short_template: The short description when starting the Action.
attributes.start_title_template: UI title of the start of the Action.
attributes.timeout: Maximum time to wait, in milliseconds.
attributes.units: Units of a Metric (e.g., bytes, blocks, packets, percent).
attributes.value: The Op statement that defines a Metric or Resource.
attributes.view_limit: The number of simultaneous metrics allowed for a permissions group.
attributes.is_run_output_persisted: A boolean value denoting whether or not cell outputs should be persisted when running a notebook
attributes.communication_workspace: A string value denoting the slack workspace where notifications related to the object should be sent to.
attributes.communication_channel: A string value denoting the slack channel where notifications related to the object should be sent to.
attributes.service_name: The name of a 3rd-party service to integrate with (e.g. 'datadog', or 'newrelic').
attributes.account_id: Account ID for a 3rd-party service integration.
attributes.api_key: API key for a 3rd-party service integration.
attributes.api_url: API url for a 3rd-party service integration.
attributes.site_url: Site/Application url for a 3rd-party service integration.
attributes.app_key: Application key for a 3rd-party service integration.
attributes.insights_collector_url: Insights url for a 3rd-party service integration.
attributes.insights_collector_api_key: Insights key for a 3rd-party service integration.
attributes.permissions_user: The user which 3rd-party service integration remediations run as (default '{{ .DEFAULT_USER_NAME }}').
attributes.dashboard_name: The name of a dashboard for 3rd-party service integration (datadog).
attributes.webhook_name: The name of a webhook for 3rd-party service integration (datadog).
attributes.cache_ttl: The amount of time group memberships will be cached (in milliseconds).
attributes.api_rate_limit: The number of API calls a client is able to make in a minute.
attributes.administrator_grants_create_user: System setting controlling if administrators can create users.
attributes.administrator_grants_create_user_token: System setting controlling if administrators can create user access tokens.
attributes.administrator_grants_regenerate_user_tok: System setting controlling if administrators can update user access tokens.
attributes.administrator_grants_read_user_token: System setting controlling if administrators can view user access tokens.
attributes.approval_feature_enabled: System setting controlling if notebook approvals are enabled.
attributes.notebook_ad_hoc_approval_request_enabled: System setting controlling if approvals are enabled for ad-hoc notebook execution.
attributes.approval_editable_allowed_resource_query: System setting controlling if notebook resource queries can be modified on approved executions.
attributes.approval_allow_individual_notification: System setting controlling if approvals notifications are sent to individual users, in case no specific notebook communication setting is defined.
attributes.approval_optional_request_ticket_url: System setting controlling if the ticket url is optional when creating an approval request.
attributes.time_trigger_permissions_user: System setting for the user that time-triggered notebooks run as.
attributes.external_audit_storage_enabled: System setting controlling if audit information is stored in an alternate location.
attributes.external_audit_storage_url: System setting for alternate audit storage URL.
attributes.external_audit_storage_type: System setting for alternate audit storage type (e.g. 'ELASTIC').
attributes.external_audit_storage_api_token: System setting for alternate audit storage API access token.
attributes.external_audit_storage_batch_period_sec: System setting for alternate audit storage batching interval (in seconds).
attributes.notebook_approval_request_expiry_time: System setting for maximum wait for approval after request (in minutes).
attributes.notebook_run_approval_expiry_time: System setting for maximum wait for execution after approval (in minutes).
attributes.environment_name: System setting for the name of the environment.
attributes.environment_name_background: System setting for the background colour of the environment name. The format is #<6-digit hex>
attributes.param_value_max_length: System setting controlling the maximum allowable length for a notebook's parameter
attributes.parallel_notebook_runs_fired_by_time_tri: System setting controlling the maximum number of different parallel notebook runs initiated via time triggers
attributes.maintenance_mode_enabled: System setting that when enabled, rejects new runs, allowing ongoing tasks to complete before stopping.
attributes.allowed_tags: Defines a list of tags that are allowed on agent tag ingestion
attributes.skipped_tags: Defines a list of tags that are skipped on agent tag ingestion
attributes.integration_name: The name/symbol of a {{ .RENDERED_PROVIDER_NAME }} integration involved in triggering the bot.
attributes.editors: List of users who can edit the object (with configure permission). Empty maps to all users.
attributes.communication_cud_notifications: Enables slack notifications for create/update/delete operations. (Requires workspace and channel.)
attributes.communication_approval_notifications: Enables slack notifications for approvals operations. (Requires workspace and channel.)
attributes.communication_execution_notifications: Enables slack notifications for the object executions. (Requires workspace and channel.)
attributes.filter_resource_to_action: Determines whether parameters containing resources are exported to actions.
attributes.external_url: External url for a 3rd-party service integration.
attributes.cache_ttl_ms: The amount of time group memberships will be cached (in milliseconds).
attributes.subject: The subject whose authentication details is used for a 3rd-party service integration (google cloud identity).
attributes.credentials: The credentials used for a 3rd-party service integration (google cloud identity), encoded in base64.
attributes.tenant_id: Tenant id for a 3rd-party service integration (Microsoft Entra ID).
attributes.client_id: Application id for a 3rd-party service integration (Microsoft Entra ID).
attributes.client_secret: Client secret for a 3rd-party service integration (Microsoft Entra ID).
attributes.blocks: The JSON encoded blocks of the report template.
attributes.links: The JSON encoded links of a report template with other report templates.
attributes.dashboard_type: Specifies the type of the dashboard configuration. Currently, only 'TAGS_SEQUENCE' is supported.
attributes.groups: A JSON-encoded list of groups in the dashboard configuration. Each group is an object with 'name' (the group's name) and 'tags' (a list of tag names belonging to the group).
attributes.values: A JSON-encoded list of objects defining the values and their associated colors in the dashboard configuration. Each object contains: 'color' (the color associated with the values) and 'values' (a list of values corresponding to specific tags).
attributes.other_tags: A list of additional tags that will be displayed for the resources.
